results.title: The Dragons of the Galapagos
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC-TV and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Filmed by David Parer and Elizabeth Parer-Cook and narrated by David Attenborough, this spectacular production tells the story of the incredible struggle for survival of the dragons of the Galapagos Archipelago. The lives of these giant lizards, called land iguanas, are intimately linked with the Archipelagos most active volcano. We follow the annual migration of the land iguanas up the steep slopes of the 1,500 metre volcano and into the steaming caldera where they lay their eggs. Along the coast of the island the worlds only sea-going lizards take us into one of the most exciting marine environments on earth, a world of huge balls of baitfish and masses of seals, dolphins and penguins.

results.title: The Dragon's tears
results.creator_credit: John Korty, Contemproary Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of Hirosuke Hamada’s story of a little boy’s fearless act of inviting a dragon to his birthday party. Utilizes Japanese-style watercolour and art work. Narrated by Robert Morse. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Dounreay project
results.creator_credit: Frank Green, Ace Films and UK Atomic Energy Authority
results.brief_description: This film shows the construction of the Dounreay Reactor. From redesigning the coastline and big tunnels beneath the ocean to cement monoliths with steel plating. We see every part of Dounreay being built and clearly explained. A product of knowledge and proudness in its day - and sadly to become one day dangerous and obsolete.

results.title: The Double helix
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Anvil Films and EFVA
results.brief_description: Part of the Nobel Laureates series. Shows the work of several scientists in determining the structure of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA). Uses animated diagrams to illustrate the structure of DNA. Discusses the significance of DNA in all living organisms. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Double-decked 'strato' clipper
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Designed to acquaint the public with the facilities provided for speedy and comfortable air travel by modern airliners, this film observes the operation of a Boeing double-decked airliner, the “Strato-cruiser”. Includes also an account of the development of trans-oceanic air travel and of the Boeing/Pan Am aircraft, pre and post WWII.

results.title: The Door
results.creator_credit: Josie Keys, Jo-Anne McGowan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The removal of a teenager’s bedroom door by her frugal step father (he has insisted the family live on weet-bix for the last three years) is emblematic of family tension in this telling film about the perils of adolescent years, and the lack of communication within the family unit. Cast includes Barry Otto, Penne Hackforth-Jones and Inge Hornstra.

results.title: The Domino
results.creator_credit: Robert Stenhouse, Hugh Macdonald and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: An individual is working happily by himself when he is increasingly interrupted by proliferating bureaucracy that eventually totally thwarts his capacity to work. This animated cartoon is an illustration of any activity that loses its originality or purpose when support services and administration become an end in themselves. An entertainment on a universal theme.
